lexUnit.name: pack.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: fill; cram a large number of things into

sentence.text: You have the choice of being snooty and tutting at people sitting in their cars , packing their faces with hot dogs , or you can pack your own face with a hot dog before you set out .
Day and weekend sacks are light enough for you to simply pack them with accessibility to key items of equipment like waterproofs the main priority .
He packed his suitcases with clothes and books .
If that does not work try packing the nostrils with cotton wool and and applying ice cubes to either side of the nose .
Next , pack the nose with cotton wool or gauze and make sure that you inform the referee in subsequent fights that you sustained this injury .
Run it into two uplifts at opposite ends of the tank , and pack it with filter floss and carbon .
His lectures were above all popular because he packed them with information .
The method used in the past few years has been simple -- ignore names put forward by organisations you do not approve of and pack the committees with more sympathetic interest groups .
I did as she said but they were two sizes too big for me ; they fitted better after she had packed the toes with scraps of wool .
When at last the work was finished , Mina and Kāli packed a basket with some clean clothes and went together to the stream to wash .
She even packed a bag for each for them .
Turn round day is a bit hectic for us , so we suggest you pack your bags in the morning , leave them in our safekeeping , and disappear to explore for the day !
As she quickly packed a bag before preparing dinner , it suddenly struck her what a risk she was taking .
Now the programme that turns the cameras on teenagers and let's them do the talking and the interviews has packed its newest series with just the subjects their viewers want .
Accordingly Baldwin packed his suitcase , instructed his parliamentary private secretary to do the same , and set off yet once more in the small black car .
That was a hint to Chris , who was sitting beside the basket that had been packed by Molly Fletcher .
This means that the pots must be packed very full and the contents pressed and pressed until they are as tightly packed as possible .
She carefully packed her case again , then scanned the tidy bedroom and bathroom with some satisfaction .
It was on a Friday night and I had packed my suitcases and taken them around to Rachel 's house so her dad could stack them on top of the car .
They have n't started packing their suitcases yet , but they fear it may be inevitable and they 'll have to come to terms with a completely new existence .
